html:
The Supreme Court on Monday extended, by two weeks, the time granted to the Competition Commission of India (CCI) by the Delhi High Court to take a decision on the show cause notice issued by it to Amazon over the Future group deal.

A Bench comprising Chief Justice of India NV Ramana, Justice Surya Kant and Justice Hima Kohli granted the two-week extension to enable Amazon to make submissions and argue its case before the CCI.

We are not going into details. Well grant two more weeks time. You use the time and appear and argue before the commission. You raise all your objections, said the Bench, according to law platform Live Law. The Bench added, Two weeks time granted more than the high court. Parties are at liberty to raise all objections before the commission. With the above observations, a special leave petition (SLP) has been disposed of.

The Bench has given direction in Amazons SLP against Delhi high courts order of November 16. It directed the CCI to take a decision with respect to the show-cause notice issued by it to Amazon in 10 days, according to Live Law.
